intros.description_before_link: I am a graduate student in the Department of Mathematical Sciences at the Korea Advanced Institute of Science and Technology (KAIST).  I am interested in mathematical modeling of circadian clocks, immunotherapy, and causality detection in biological systems.

intros.description_after_link: in KAIST and IBS Biomedical Mathematics group.

timestamps.activity: Ph.D Candidate in Mathematical biology, KAIST

publications.title: Spatially coordinated collective phosphorylation filters spatiotemporal noises for precise circadian timekeeping
publications.authors: Seok Joo Chae, Dae Wook Kim, Seunggyu Lee, and Jae Kyoung Kim

projects.title: Modeling spatiotemporal heterogeneity and its filtering in the circadian clocks
projects.description: Studied how spatially coordinated collective phosphorylation filters spatiotemporal noises for precise circadian timekeeping

projects.title: Optimizing Immunotherapy strategy against tumor using NK cells
projects.description: Collaborative study with biologists in KRIBB to understand NK killing mechanism and improve tumor killing capacity

projects.title: Detecting causality
projects.description: Studied how spatially coordinated collective phosphorylation filters spatiotemporal noises for precise circadian timekeeping
